metadata.synopsis: If the player sided with the goblins and helped sack the Grove, Halsin (if still alive) will show up at a subsequent camp night seeking vengeance. There's no way to calm him - the dialogue will always end with combat against him and some animals.

1.speaker: Halsin
1.text: When I met you, I thought we were destined to be allies. But you made that impossible.
1.context: NodeContext: The player met Halsin before in the goblin camp. They could've become allies, but now that's impossible

11.speaker: Halsin
11.text: The grove stood for generations. It was our link to Silvanus. Now it's nothing but blood and ashes - thanks to you.
11.context: NodeContext: Cold fury. He's already wept for the grove - now he's here for retribution

4.speaker: Halsin
4.text: Tell me... was it worth it?
4.context: NodeContext: Rhetorical. He's not letting the player off the hook for what they did.

8.speaker: Player
8.text: Wait... who the hells are you?
8.context: CinematicNodeContext: Note - some animals will join Halsin's side in the fight that ensues - might be nice to show them appear from the dark behind him if possible.InternalNodeContext: Note - some animals will join Halsin's side in the fight that ensues - might be nice to show them appear from the dark behind him if possible.NodeContext: 'I'm the one who's going to kill you'

13.speaker: Halsin
13.text: I am Halsin. First Druid of the Emerald Grove. And I am here to visit nature's fury upon you.
13.context: CinematicNodeContext: Note - some animals will join Halsin's side in the fight that ensues - might be nice to show them appear from the dark behind him if possible.InternalNodeContext: Note - some animals will join Halsin's side in the fight that ensues - might be nice to show them appear from the dark behind him if possible.NodeContext: 'I'm the one who's going to kill you'

3.speaker: Player
3.text: Of course - I did what I had to do. Your grove got in the way.
3.context: NodeContext: Appalled and furious at the player's callousness.

2.speaker: Halsin
2.text: You have no idea what you've done, do you? Or perhaps you simply don't care?
2.context: NodeContext: Appalled and furious at the player's callousness.

9.speaker: Player
9.text: I'm sorry. I had no choice.

6.speaker: Halsin
6.text: There's always a choice - but you made yours. Now I make mine.

16.speaker: Player
16.text: Calm down. Come sit by the fire and we can talk this over.
16.context: NodeContext: His mind is made up. It was made up before he appeared here.

0.speaker: Halsin
0.text: There's nothing left to be said. My mercy died when I saw the grove.
0.context: NodeContext: His mind is made up. It was made up before he appeared here.

12.speaker: Halsin
12.text: You have upended nature's balance. Only your death can restore it.
12.context: CinematicNodeContext: Note - some animals will join Halsin's side in the fight that ensues - might be nice to show them appear from the dark behind him if possible.InternalNodeContext: Combat ensues - Halsin + animals against the player.NodeContext: Resigned to the bloodshed to follow (combat immediately after this line)

5.speaker: Player
5.context: InternalNodeContext: Combat ensues - Halsin + animals against the player.

7.speaker: Halsin
7.text: Look at you - camping amidst the Oak Father's creations, as if you hadn't just defiled  his most sacred ground.
7.context: NodeContext: Cold fury. He's already wept for the grove - now he's here for retribution

10.speaker: Halsin
10.text: Look at you - resting without a care, as if you hadn't just defiled  the Oak Father's most sacred ground.
10.context: NodeContext: Cold fury. He's already wept for the grove - now he's here for retribution

15.speaker: Halsin
15.text: I thought you'd help me. I thought we'd help each other. Instead you chose this.
15.context: NodeContext: The player met Halsin before in the goblin camp. They could've become allies, but now that's impossible
